translated: here too the expression “non-existent” is understood.

original: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says “just as,” and so on.

original: ji ltar / rgyu dang 'bras nyid grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar / rgyu dang 'bras nyid grub par 'gyur //
translated: Just as the expression “cause” and “effect” is established,

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: from what?

original: mthong dang ma mthong las /
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong las /
translated: “From the seen and unseen.”

original: dper na mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la 'bras bu dang rgyu'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the expression “effect” and “cause” is established from the seen and unseen.

original: 'di gnyis las gzhan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: 'di gnyis las gzhan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu zhes bya ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Because of the otherness of these two, the expression “cause” and “effect” is imputed.

original: de dag la ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la ni 'bras sogs sgra'i /
analyzed: de dag la ni mthong ba dang ma mthong ba dag la ni 'bras sogs sgra'i /
translated: For them, the expression “effect” and “cause” is from the seen and unseen.

original: tha snyad phyir ni brtags pa yin //
analyzed: tha snyad phyir ni brtags pa yin //
translated: The expression is imputed because of the effect, etc.

original: 'di ltar mi dmigs pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dmigs pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: In this way, because of the cause of non-apprehension,

original: med pa'i shes pa la sos par rung ba nyid kyi /
analyzed: med pa'i shes pa la sos par rung ba nyid kyi /
translated: It is suitable to be called “the arising of the cognition of nonexistence.”

original: 'bras bu grub pas na /
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pas na /
translated: Since the result is established,

original: de bas na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: de bas na rang bzhin mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: therefore the nonobservation of nature

original: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi nang du 'dus pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: is included within the reason of nature.

original: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore this nonobservation of nature

original: rang bzhin nang 'dus phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin nang 'dus phyir /
translated: is included within nature.

original: gtan tshigs rab dbye bshad pa la //
analyzed: gtan tshigs rab dbye bshad pa la //
translated: In the explanation of the divisions of reasons,

original: tha snyad dpe bstan med pa can //
analyzed: tha snyad dpe bstan med pa can //
translated: there are those that are not taught with an example.

original: gang la dpe bstan pa med pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang la dpe bstan pa med pa zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase “that are not taught with an example” should be applied to this.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa de nyid ji ltar grub pa yin zhing gang gis med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa de nyid ji ltar grub pa yin zhing gang gis med pa'i shes pa la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: If it is said, “How is that nonobservation itself established? By what is the cognition of nonexistence and so on to be established?”

original: skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon de yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That fault does not exist.

original: 'di ltar / gcig dmigs nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar / gcig dmigs nyams su myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the observation of one thing is experienced,

original: don gcig gzhan dang 'dra ba can dmigs pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir dus phyis dngos bo 'di ni dmigs pa med ce'am /
analyzed: don gcig gzhan dang 'dra ba can dmigs pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir dus phyis dngos bo 'di ni dmigs pa med ce'am /
translated: because the observation of one thing that is similar to another is experienced, later on one says, “This thing is not observed” or “This thing does not exist.”

original: dmigs pa zhes ni rtogs pa yi //
analyzed: dmigs pa zhes ni rtogs pa yi //
translated: The object is known as the object of cognition.

original: de ltar / blo ni nges par 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: de ltar / blo ni nges par 'gyur ba yin /
translated: Thus, the mind is definitely transformed.

original: gcig dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de tsam brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: gcig dmigs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba de tsam brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is to be said that “because of the perception of one,”

original: dogs pa gang gis nyams su myong bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dogs pa gang gis nyams su myong bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the experience of doubt,🔽he says,

original: tshor ba khyad par can nyid phyir /
analyzed: tshor ba khyad par can nyid phyir /
translated: Because of the special nature of sensation,

original: don rnams khyad par rtogs par 'gyur //🔽zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don rnams khyad par rtogs par 'gyur // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: one understands the difference of objects.

original: @323b de skad du de ni re zhig don ni rang yod pa nyid tsam gyi tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: @323b de skad du de ni re zhig don ni rang yod pa nyid tsam gyi tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the object is not established as either different or non-different from the mere existence of itself.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: shes pa'i dbang las yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i dbang las yin no //
translated: It is due to the power of cognition.

original: gal te tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is not different, then at that time,

original: don tha dad pa'am tha dad pa med pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don tha dad pa'am tha dad pa med pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: the object is established as either different or non-different.

original: ji ltar myong ba tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med pa dag gis don tha dad pa dang tha dad pa yin pa de ltar de shes pa'i shes pa tha dad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar myong ba tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med pa dag gis don tha dad pa dang tha dad pa yin pa de ltar de shes pa'i shes pa tha dad pa /
translated: Just as the object is different or non-different due to the difference or non-difference of experience, so the cognition of that object is different or non-different due to the difference or non-difference of the cognition.

original: med pa dag gis shes pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa dag gis shes pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it known by what is nonexistent.

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is it, then?

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid de ji ltar gzhan dang 'dres pa can nam gzhan dang 'dres pa can ma yin pa gsal bar byed pa de ltar tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //🔽de ltar bstan pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid de ji ltar gzhan dang 'dres pa can nam gzhan dang 'dres pa can ma yin pa gsal bar byed pa de ltar tha dad pa dang / tha dad pa med pa'i shes pa'i yul du 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur ro // de ltar bstan pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba gsungs pa yin no //
translated: It is the nature of consciousness. Just as it is manifested as mixed with something else or unmixed with something else, in the same way, it is the object of consciousness, either as differentiated or as undifferentiated.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar na /🔽de lta'i bdag nyid myong ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar na / de lta'i bdag nyid myong ba /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:🔽“Experience” is the nature of consciousness.

original: so sor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba nyid ni /
analyzed: so sor nges pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyams su myong ba nyid ni /
translated: The experience of a specific nature

original: shes 'di'i tha dad blo rgyu yin //
analyzed: shes 'di'i tha dad blo rgyu yin //
translated: is the cause of the cognition of difference.

original: de'i myong ba'i khyad par gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i myong ba'i khyad par gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the experience of something else.

original: des na don gyi rnam pa tha dad pa'i 'dzin pa can gyi /
analyzed: des na don gyi rnam pa tha dad pa'i 'dzin pa can gyi /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the difference of the aspects of the object

original: blo gnyis tha dad grub pa yin te /
analyzed: blo gnyis tha dad grub pa yin te /
translated: establishes the difference of the two cognitions.

original: dper na blo 'di las tha dad pa yin no zhes rang nyid las grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na blo 'di las tha dad pa yin no zhes rang nyid las grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: For example, it is established from itself that “this cognition is different from that cognition.”

original: yang shes pa /🔽de dag gis de'i don /
analyzed: yang shes pa / de dag gis de'i don /
translated: And the consciousnesses🔽The objects of those consciousnesses🔽The objects of those different consciousnesses

original: shes pa tha dad pa de dag gi yul du gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de dag ni /🔽rang gi yul du gyur pa'i shes pa dag las tha dad par grub pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pa de dag gi yul du gyur pa'i don gang yin pa de dag ni / rang gi yul du gyur pa'i shes pa dag las tha dad par grub pa nyid yin no //
translated: are established as different from the consciousnesses that are their objects.

original: de lta min na gal te /
analyzed: de lta min na gal te /
translated: If that were not so,

original: blo rang nyid las tha dad pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: blo rang nyid las tha dad pa ma yin gyi /
translated: if the object were not different from the consciousness,

original: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci yin zhe na /
translated: then what is it?🔽If it were different from the consciousness,

original: shes pa'i shas pa tha dad pa las yin na /🔽de'i tshe de yang rang rig pa'i khyad par gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa yin zhing /🔽gzhan las yin pa de ltar na thug med phyir te /🔽rgyu'i phyir gcig gi yang tha dad pa ma grub pa na thams cad kyi mi 'grub pa de ltar na /
analyzed: shes pa'i shas pa tha dad pa las yin na / de'i tshe de yang rang rig pa'i khyad par gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa yin zhing / gzhan las yin pa de ltar na thug med phyir te / rgyu'i phyir gcig gi yang tha dad pa ma grub pa na thams cad kyi mi 'grub pa de ltar na /
translated: then it would be different from the consciousness that is aware of itself,

original: 'ga' zhig tha dad grub mi 'gyur //🔽shes pa'am / don 'ga' zhig gi yang tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tha dad grub mi 'gyur // shes pa'am / don 'ga' zhig gi yang tha dad pa'am /
translated: and if it were different from that, then there would be an infinite regress.🔽If it were different from that, then there would be an infinite regress, because it would be different from another consciousness that is aware of itself.

original: tha dad pa med pa grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were different from that, then there would be an infinite regress, because it would be different from another consciousness that is aware of itself.🔽If it were different from that, then there would be an infinite regress, because it would be different from another consciousness that is aware of itself.🔽If it were different from that, then there would be an infinite regress, another consciousness

original: de ltar na gdon mi za bar shes pa bdag nyid kyi khyad par du gyur pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gdon mi za bar shes pa bdag nyid kyi khyad par du gyur pa yin no zhes khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, it must be accepted that the nature of consciousness is indeed unique.

original: 'dis kyang shes pa rang rig la grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis kyang shes pa rang rig la grub pa yin no //
translated: This also proves that consciousness is reflexive awareness.

original: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: zhar la 'ongs pa rdzogs so /
translated: The digression is now complete.

original: // / @324a * //  de bas na /
analyzed: // / @324a * //  de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: khyad par can dngos po myong ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par can dngos po myong ba de'i phyir /
translated: because of the experience of a unique entity,

original: gzhan dang 'dres pa ma yin pa'i don gyi rang gi ngo bo rnam par nges pa dmigs pa myong pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan dang 'dres pa ma yin pa'i don gyi rang gi ngo bo rnam par nges pa dmigs pa myong pa'i phyir /
translated: the object’s own nature, which is not mixed with anything else, is ascertained.

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i don te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i don te /
translated: The meaning of nonapprehension, which has the characteristic of an object,

original: bsal ba ste /
analyzed: bsal ba ste /
translated: is the exclusion🔽of something else.

original: bkag pas ni gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: bkag pas ni gzhan ma yin /
translated: It is not something else that is negated.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: de las khyad par can dmigs pa /
analyzed: de las khyad par can dmigs pa /
translated: the apprehension of something unique

original: de dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: de dgag par bya ba bum pa la sogs pa /
translated: is the negation of something else, such as a pot.

original: de las khyad par can 'ga' zhig / don des dben pa'i ngo bo can gyi don dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid dgag par bya ba nyid du brjod par 'dod ba'i don de yang mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de las khyad par can 'ga' zhig / don des dben pa'i ngo bo can gyi don dmigs pa gang yin pa de nyid dgag par bya ba nyid du brjod par 'dod ba'i don de yang mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The object that is the basis of the negation is the apprehension of an object that has the nature of being devoid of that object.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan dmigs pa nyid ma yin par dgag pa mi dmigs pa brjod pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan dmigs pa nyid ma yin par dgag pa mi dmigs pa brjod pa /
translated: Because of that, non-observation is not the observation of something else.

original: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pa 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this non-observation

original: mngon sum bdag nyid kho nas rtogs /
analyzed: mngon sum bdag nyid kho nas rtogs /
translated: is understood by the nature of direct perception.

original: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa yin te /
translated: It is established by the direct perception of reflexive awareness,

original: gcig dmigs pa nyid gzhan mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig dmigs pa nyid gzhan mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the observation of one thing is the non-observation of another.

original: de yang shes pa shes pa gzhan las khyad par ma grub pa can du gyur pa /
analyzed: de yang shes pa shes pa gzhan las khyad par ma grub pa can du gyur pa /
translated: Moreover, consciousness is not established as distinct from another consciousness.

original: go byed nyid yin no //
analyzed: go byed nyid yin no //
translated: It is the very conveyor of understanding.

original: gang gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: de med rnam gzhag gis te /
analyzed: de med rnam gzhag gis te /
translated: It is the absence of that, the arrangement.

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi'o //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi'o //
translated: It is the convention of absence.

original: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: rang nyid tsam gyis 'jug pa can /
analyzed: rang nyid tsam gyis 'jug pa can /
translated: It is the mere engagement of itself.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nye ba tsam gyis 'jug pa'i chos can no //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang gi ngo bo nye ba tsam gyis 'jug pa'i chos can no //
translated: It is a phenomenon that engages by the mere presence of the nature of non-observation.

original: de la gang gi tshe rnam pa gcig tu rnam par nges pa'i don can gyi mi dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe yul du gyur pa las yul can gyi tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe rnam pa gcig tu rnam par nges pa'i don can gyi mi dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe yul du gyur pa las yul can gyi tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: When it has the meaning of being ascertained in one aspect as non-observation, at that time the object is established as the subject of the convention.

original: ci ste yang shes pa mi dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste yang shes pa mi dmigs pa yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if the cognition is not observed,

original: rgyu mtshan nges rgyu mtshan can gyi tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan nges rgyu mtshan can gyi tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: then the reason is established by the mere presence of the reason.🔽In that case, the object of ascertainment is not established.

original: de ltar na rnam par nges pa'i yul grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar na rnam par nges pa'i yul grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: At that time,

original: mi dmigs pa las ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las ni /
translated: because of non-observation,

original: don med pa la 'jug par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don med pa la 'jug par 'gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: one would engage in meaningless activity.

original: 'di gnyis ni /🔽rang nyid tsam gyis 'jug pa can //
analyzed: 'di gnyis ni / rang nyid tsam gyis 'jug pa can //
translated: These two

original: zhes bya gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya gsungs pa yin no //
translated: are said to engage by themselves alone.

original: gzhan du gal te rang nyid las mi dmigs pa grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gzhan du gal te rang nyid las mi dmigs pa grub par mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: Otherwise, if non-observation were not established by itself,

original: mi dmigs pa las ni /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa las ni /
translated: then from non-observation,

original: don med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: don med pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur //
translated: one would realize meaninglessness.

original: yul la dmigs pa ldog pa las so //
analyzed: yul la dmigs pa ldog pa las so //
translated: From the cessation of observing an object.

original: gzhan gyi yul la dmigs pa de yang med pa nyid /
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul la dmigs pa de yang med pa nyid /
translated: That observation of another object also does not exist,

original: yul dmigs @324b pa mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: yul dmigs @324b pa mi dmigs pas so //
translated: because the object is not observed.

original: de ltar na ni thug med 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar na ni thug med 'gyur //
translated: In that case, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de bas na 'ga' zhig kyang med pa nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'ga' zhig kyang med pa nyid du grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, nothing is established as non-existent.

original: de de ltar na mi dmigs pa de lta bur gyur pas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i don dag la med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de ltar na mi dmigs pa de lta bur gyur pas dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'i don dag la med par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, since non-apprehension is of that sort, it is the apprehension of the non-existence of objects that have the character of being apprehended.

original: don mi snang ba la yang med pa'i nges pa mi rung phyir /
analyzed: don mi snang ba la yang med pa'i nges pa mi rung phyir /
translated: And, since it is not possible to ascertain non-existence in the absence of the appearance of an object,

original: ci ste yod pa'am ci de med pa nyid las mi dmigs pa yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: ci ste yod pa'am ci de med pa nyid las mi dmigs pa yin no zhe'o //
translated: one might say that it is either existent or that non-apprehension is due to the non-existence of that.

original: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don gzhan la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi don gzhan la gnas pa ste /
translated: However, it is the existence of another object that has the character of non-apprehension,

original: yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog par 'gyur te /
translated: and the designation of existence is thereby refuted.

original: mi snang ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa ni yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa ni yod pa'i tha snyad 'gog pa'i 'bras bu can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that non-apprehension, which has as its object something that does not appear, has the effect of refuting the designation of existence.

original: de ltar dmigs pa na yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa na yod pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yin la /
translated: Thus, when there is apprehension, there is the designation of existence.

original: de don gang la med pa de las yod pa'i tha snyad ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de don gang la med pa de las yod pa'i tha snyad ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: And, when there is no existence of that object, the designation of existence is thereby refuted.

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul du gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it becomes the object of the designation of non-existence.

original: dper rtags can min /
analyzed: dper rtags can min /
translated: For example, it is like the non-existence of a horse in a cow.

original: rtags yod pa ma yin pa can no //🔽rnam rtog sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni /
analyzed: rtags yod pa ma yin pa can no // rnam rtog sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pas ni /
translated: It is a non-existent sign.

original: shes pa'i shes la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: shes pa'i shes la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase “conceptualization, etc.” includes the cognition of cognition, etc.

original: sems can gzhan la /
analyzed: sems can gzhan la /
translated: It is not perceived in other sentient beings.

original: skye ba dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dbang po las 'das pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because of the transcendence of the senses.

original: mi dmigs par 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: mi dmigs par 'gyur ba na /
translated: When there is non-apprehension,

original: 'grub pa mi 'gyur bzhin no //
analyzed: 'grub pa mi 'gyur bzhin no //
translated: there is no establishment.

original: de ltar na yang de la med pa'i tha snyad nyid 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang de la med pa'i tha snyad nyid 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Even so, the convention of non-existence does not apply to it.

original: yang ci'i phyir mi dmigs pa de dag yod na yang med pa'i tha snyad 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir mi dmigs pa de dag yod na yang med pa'i tha snyad 'jug par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Again, why does the convention of non-existence not apply when those non-apprehensions exist?

original: 'di ltar / 'bras bu nges med can de dag / mi snang ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'bras bu nges med can de dag / mi snang ba'i yul can gyi mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Because those results are indeterminate, they are non-apprehensions with imperceptible objects.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni yod pa dang med pa'i tha snyad yin zhing /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i rgyu mtshan can ni yod pa dang med pa'i tha snyad yin zhing /
translated: The convention of existence and non-existence is based on the reason of establishing existence and non-existence.

original: de la ji ltar yod pa grub pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la ji ltar yod pa grub pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: There, because of the non-establishment of existence,

original: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the conventions of conceptualization, etc. would not be engaged.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: 'di ldog pa bsgrub la nus pa med /
analyzed: 'di ldog pa bsgrub la nus pa med /
translated: it is not possible to establish the negation of this.

original: ldog pa nges pa la'o //
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa la'o //
translated: [It is not possible] to ascertain the negation.

original: dang por yang rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa med pa sgrub par byed pa la /
analyzed: dang por yang rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa med pa sgrub par byed pa la /
translated: First, in establishing the non-existence of the non-perception of cause, etc.,

original: gtan tshigs de dag mi mthun ba'i phyogs las ldog pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de dag mi mthun ba'i phyogs las ldog pa nges pa yin no //
translated: those reasons are ascertained as the negation of the discordant class.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nges pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs tshul gsum pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don bsgrub phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs tshul gsum pa nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i don bsgrub phyir ro //
translated: Because the very ascertainment of the trimodal logical reason establishes the object to be established.

original: de yang nges par byed pa'i ngang tshul dang po'i mi dmigs pa nyid yin no //🔽bdag nyid sbyor ba @325a * //🔽dag la de'i /
analyzed: de yang nges par byed pa'i ngang tshul dang po'i mi dmigs pa nyid yin no // bdag nyid sbyor ba @325a * // dag la de'i /
translated: And that is done by the very first non-perception that has the character of ascertainment.🔽In the case of the application of the logical reason of non-apprehension,

original: med pa sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: med pa sgrub par byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: the nature of the establishment of non-existence is

original: mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo sbyor ba'am /🔽don la gnod byed ngo bo ste //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i ngo bo sbyor ba'am / don la gnod byed ngo bo ste //
translated: the nature of non-apprehension, or🔽the nature of the contradiction of the object.

original: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu dmigs pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: It is the nature of the apprehension of the opposite.

original: don 'di la gnod par byed pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid gang las rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: don 'di la gnod par byed pa 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di nyid gang las rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: How do you know that this is what harms the object?

original: gang gis don la gnod byed ngo bo sbyor ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis don la gnod byed ngo bo sbyor ba yin zhe na /
translated: What harms the object is the application of the essence.

original: yod na yod pas med phyir ram //
analyzed: yod na yod pas med phyir ram //
translated: If it exists, it exists because it does not exist.

original: rgyu ma gtugs pa can yod na med phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu ma gtugs pa can yod na med phyir te /
translated: If it exists, it does not exist because it is not a cause.

original: snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi grang ba dang / dro ba'i reg pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽phan tshun tha dad grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: snang ba'i bdag nyid can gyi grang ba dang / dro ba'i reg pa bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // phan tshun tha dad grub pa'i phyir //
translated: It is like the touch of cold and heat that have the nature of appearance. This is the meaning.🔽Because they are established as mutually different.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are mutually exclusive and contradictory.

original: brtan dngos dang ni 'jig pa bzhin //
analyzed: brtan dngos dang ni 'jig pa bzhin //
translated: Like a stable entity and destruction.

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: Like permanence and impermanence.

original: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba ni cig shos kho na yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig mi gnas pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'gal ba ni cig shos kho na yin no //
translated: Mutually exclusive contradiction has the characteristic of not coexisting.

original: de yang snang ba dang mi snang ba'i yul gyi khyad par las gnyis su nges par byas nas /
analyzed: de yang snang ba dang mi snang ba'i yul gyi khyad par las gnyis su nges par byas nas /
translated: Having determined that it is twofold based on the distinction of visible and invisible objects,

original: rnam pa gnyis su bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is taught in two ways.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'i phyir dang brgyud pas kyang 'gal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa'i phyir dang brgyud pas kyang 'gal par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is contradicted by other valid cognitions, and because it is indirectly contradictory.

original: res 'ga' ba dang ltos med bzhin //
analyzed: res 'ga' ba dang ltos med bzhin //
translated: Like being occasional and not depending.

original: dngos po gang la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: dngos po gang la ltos pa med pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Whatever things do not depend on something else,

original: res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: they are not occasional.

original: dper na rgyu'i tshogs pa tha ma la gags byed pa mi srid pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyu'i tshogs pa tha ma la gags byed pa mi srid pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the final collection of causes, where obstruction is impossible.

original: de 'dir ltos pa med pa dang // res 'ga' ba nyid ni dngos su 'gal ba yod pa ma yin na yang /🔽ltos pa med pa nyid kyi khyab par byed pa brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / lhan cig res 'ga' ba nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ba na /
analyzed: de 'dir ltos pa med pa dang // res 'ga' ba nyid ni dngos su 'gal ba yod pa ma yin na yang / ltos pa med pa nyid kyi khyab par byed pa brtan pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / lhan cig res 'ga' ba nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ba na /
translated: Here, although there is no explicit contradiction between not depending and being occasional,🔽when not depending is the pervader and the nature of stability is the pervaded, and being occasional is the contradiction,

original: ltos pa med pa nyid dang / don gyis 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid dang / don gyis 'gal ba yin no //
translated: then not depending and being occasional are implicitly contradictory.

original: ci ste sgra 'jig pa la ltos pa med par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste sgra 'jig pa la ltos pa med par mi 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If one does not assert that sound's destruction does not depend on something else,

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can du nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can du nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would not be ascertained as having the nature of destruction.

original: de ltar ni /
analyzed: de ltar ni /
translated: In that case,

original: nye ba yin na rgyu gzhan gyi //
analyzed: nye ba yin na rgyu gzhan gyi //
translated: If it is a proximate cause, then it is not a cause.

original: kun slong nges pa gang las yin //
analyzed: kun slong nges pa gang las yin //
translated: What is the intention in the determination of the cause?

original: ma yin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is not so.

original: dngos po gang la ltos pa bcas par 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: dngos po gang la ltos pa bcas par 'dod pa gang yin pa de dag ni /
translated: Those things that are held to be dependent

original: de'i ngo bo nges par 'dod pa nyid yin par mi bya /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nges par 'dod pa nyid yin par mi bya /
translated: are not held to be determined in their own nature.

original: dper na gos la tshon bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gos la tshon bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a cloth and dye.

original: dngos po skye ba dang ldan pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ni ltos pa dang bcas pa yin par 'dod @325b pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dngos po skye ba dang ldan pa 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ni ltos pa dang bcas pa yin par 'dod @325b pa yang yin no //
translated: The thing that has arising and the nature of destruction is held to be dependent.

original: de ltar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: It is not so.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause

original: dngos po rgyu las byung nyid na //🔽dngos po 'grub byed pa rgyu nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos /
analyzed: dngos po rgyu las byung nyid na // dngos po 'grub byed pa rgyu nyid kyis mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'i chos /
translated: is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.

original: dngos po 'jig pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa skyed par byed do //
translated: The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.🔽The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.

original: des ni dngos po 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des ni dngos po 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa yin no //
translated: The thing that is produced from a cause is impermanent by the nature of being produced from a cause.

original: de'i tshe yang /🔽brgyud pa'i dub pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de'i tshe yang /🔽brgyud pa'i dub pas ci zhig bya //
translated: The thing that is

original: rang yod pa nyid kyi rgyu nyid las dngos po 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa de de 'dra bar gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: rang yod pa nyid kyi rgyu nyid las dngos po 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du nges pa de de 'dra bar gyur pa yin na /
translated: The cause of its own existence is ascertained as the nature of the thing’s disintegration.🔽

original: brgyud pas ci zhig bya /🔽gzhan yang / gzhan 'jig ste mi rtag nyid la sogs pa dngos po 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brgyud pas ci zhig bya / gzhan yang / gzhan 'jig ste mi rtag nyid la sogs pa dngos po 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: If the nature of the disintegration of a thing is ascertained to be the cause of its own existence, then what use is there for it to be a continuum?🔽Moreover, disintegration is impermanence, etc.

original: skyed par byed pa nyid yin no //🔽dngos de'i skyed par byed pa'i rgyu /🔽des dngos po de'i 'jig byed yin par 'dod na gal te dngos su de nyid 'jig pa'i dngos /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa nyid yin no // dngos de'i skyed par byed pa'i rgyu / des dngos po de'i 'jig byed yin par 'dod na gal te dngos su de nyid 'jig pa'i dngos /
translated: It is the cause of the disintegration of things.

original: skyed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: skyed par 'gyur na /
translated: If you assert that the cause of the generation of a thing is the cause of its disintegration, then if that thing is directly generated,

original: mi 'dod pa ci zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ci zhig 'gyur //
translated: what is undesirable about that?

original: gal te cir yang mi 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te cir yang mi 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: If you say, “Nothing is undesirable,”

original: 'on kyang de nyid ni /🔽dngos po rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rim pa yin pa de bas na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de nyid ni / dngos po rnams kyi 'jug pa'i rim pa yin pa de bas na /
translated: then that is🔽the process of the engagement of things.

original: de dag ji lta bur 'gyur ba nyid yin par sems pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag ji lta bur 'gyur ba nyid yin par sems pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, we think that things are just like that,

original: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: but not in any other way.

original: de de ltar ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de de ltar ma yin gyi /
translated: That is not so.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: In that case, they would be two.

original: gal te dngos po 'jig pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de dngos po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin byed pas bdag la phan pa byed pa'am /
analyzed: gal te dngos po 'jig pa mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de dngos po'i bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'jig pa'i rang bzhin byed pas bdag la phan pa byed pa'am /
translated: If that which is impermanent, such as the disintegration of a thing, is the nature of a thing, then it would be the case that disintegration is the nature of a thing that benefits itself.

original: ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Or, it would be the case that it does not benefit itself.

original: gal te bdag la phan par byed pa yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te bdag la phan par byed pa yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe /
translated: If it is maintained that it benefits itself,

original: dngos po de /
analyzed: dngos po de /
translated: then that thing

original: de grub bdag nyid can 'gyur na /
analyzed: de grub bdag nyid can 'gyur na /
translated: would have the nature of that which is already established.

original: rgyu grub pa'i rang bzhin can grub par gyur na /
analyzed: rgyu grub pa'i rang bzhin can grub par gyur na /
translated: If the nature of an established cause were established,

original: de bdag la phan byed 'gyur pa ci cir 'gyur /
analyzed: de bdag la phan byed 'gyur pa ci cir 'gyur /
translated: what would be the point of its benefiting itself?

original: ma yin pa nyid de bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid de bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It would not, because it would be devoid of activity.

original: ci ste bdag la phan par mi 'gyur ba de /
analyzed: ci ste bdag la phan par mi 'gyur ba de /
translated: But if it is maintained that it does not benefit itself,🔽then when

original: 'dod pa'i tshe na /🔽'gyur na ci ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i tshe na / 'gyur na ci ste /
translated: it is established,

original: 'di'i 'ga' zhig tu yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di'i 'ga' zhig tu yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: why would it not benefit itself in some way?

original: cung zad kyang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad kyang byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be devoid of activity.

original: dngos po de bas na gang la ltos par 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po de bas na gang la ltos par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, in dependence on what would that thing be?

original: 'jig pa'i dngos po la'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i dngos po la'o //
translated: It would be in dependence on the thing that is disintegrating.

original: de ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu rtog pa don med pa can no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'jig pa'i rgyu rtog pa don med pa can no //
translated: Thus, the conception of a cause of disintegration is pointless.

original: ci ste 'jig pa nyid 'ga' zhig la ltos pa med cing /
analyzed: ci ste 'jig pa nyid 'ga' zhig la ltos pa med cing /
translated: But if destruction itself does not depend on anything else,

original: dngos po bskyed par 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: dngos po bskyed par 'gyur pa de'i tshe /
translated: and things are produced,

original: ltos pa'i ngang bzhin med na'ang 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jig pa'i rang bzhin med pa de lta bur 'gyur ba min nam ci /🔽rtag tu 'jig @326a * //
analyzed: ltos pa'i ngang bzhin med na'ang 'ga' zhig gi tshe 'jig pa'i rang bzhin med pa de lta bur 'gyur ba min nam ci / rtag tu 'jig @326a * //
translated: then even without depending on anything else, at some point, destruction would not be nonexistent.

original: pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would always have the nature of destruction.

original: dper na de nyid 'byung 'jig can /
analyzed: dper na de nyid 'byung 'jig can /
translated: For example, it is like that which has the nature of arising and destruction.

original: gang la 'byung ma thag tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yod pa de ltar na 'byung 'jig can no //
analyzed: gang la 'byung ma thag tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin yod pa de ltar na 'byung 'jig can no //
translated: That which has the nature of destruction immediately after arising has the nature of arising and destruction.

original: sdod pa la brten mi 'dod bzhin //
analyzed: sdod pa la brten mi 'dod bzhin //
translated: It is not maintained that it depends on enduring.

original: sdod pa la rten par byed pas na /
analyzed: sdod pa la rten par byed pas na /
translated: Since it makes enduring depend on itself,

original: sdod pa la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sdod pa la brten pa'o //
translated: it makes enduring depend on itself.

original: sdod pa la brten par byed par mi 'dod bzhin te /
analyzed: sdod pa la brten par byed par mi 'dod bzhin te /
translated: It is not maintained that it makes enduring depend on itself,

original: sdod pas 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sdod pas 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: because enduring does not have the nature of destruction.

original: de ltar na snga ma'i gnas skabs las de la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na snga ma'i gnas skabs las de la ltos pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, since it does not depend on that earlier state,

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin can nyid yin no //
translated: it has the nature of destruction.

original: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: This is so, but

original: gal te skad cig kyang ltos med //
analyzed: gal te skad cig kyang ltos med //
translated: if it is not dependent even for a moment,

original: dngos po 'byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po 'byung ba ma yin no //
translated: an entity does not arise.

original: dngos po med pa'i 'jig pa yin zhing de yang gal te mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe skad cig ma gcig la yang de nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i rtag tu dngos po med pas dngos po'i 'byung ba ste
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i 'jig pa yin zhing de yang gal te mi 'dod pa nyid kyi phyir thams cad kyi tshe 'gyur ba de'i tshe skad cig ma gcig la yang de nyid dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa'i rtag tu dngos po med pas dngos po'i 'byung ba ste
translated: If you do not accept that an entity is destroyed without an external cause, and if it is always changing, then at no time would it be an entity, since it would always be devoid of the nature of an entity.

original: / skye ba nyid du 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: / skye ba nyid du 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the arising of an entity, i.e., its birth, would never occur even for a moment.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo yongs su shes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature of an entity is not fully understood.

original: dngos de de ltar 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: dngos de de ltar 'gyur ba yin /
translated: An entity is like that,

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du'o //
translated: i.e., it has the nature of destruction.

original: de yang gang gi tshe skad cig ma der yang mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: de yang gang gi tshe skad cig ma der yang mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: Moreover, if it is not so even for a moment,

original: dngos po 'joms pa'i mtshan nyid can la sogs pa'i 'jig pa yod pa med par 'jig pa mi rung pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po 'joms pa'i mtshan nyid can la sogs pa'i 'jig pa yod pa med par 'jig pa mi rung pa'i phyir /
translated: then since it is not possible for an entity to be destroyed without the characteristic of destruction, etc.,

original: dngos po 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can du mi 'gyur ro //🔽de bas na dngos po yod pa nyid 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
analyzed: dngos po 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can du mi 'gyur ro // de bas na dngos po yod pa nyid 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin pa de ltar na /
translated: It would not have the character of the destruction of things.🔽Therefore, it is not reasonable that an existent thing has the nature of destruction.

original: gdon mi za bar dngos po skad cig ma nyid yin no //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar dngos po skad cig ma nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, without a doubt, things are momentary.

original: ci ste skad cig ma nyid la yang dngos por 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste skad cig ma nyid la yang dngos por 'gyur ba de'i tshe /
translated: But if even momentariness is a thing,

original: de ltar med yod ji ltar rung /
analyzed: de ltar med yod ji ltar rung /
translated: how could it be both existent and nonexistent?

original: dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur na /🔽'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po mi rtag par mi 'gyur na / 'ga' zhig kyang med pa'i phyir /
translated: If a thing is not impermanent,

original: gang de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gang de ni cir yang mi rung ngo //
translated: then it is nothing at all, because it is not nonexistent.

original: gzhan yang dngos po rang bzhin nyid kyis 'jig pa'am ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan yang dngos po rang bzhin nyid kyis 'jig pa'am ma yin par 'gyur grang na /
translated: Moreover, a thing would either be essentially perishable or not perishable.

original: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can nyid yin na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can nyid yin na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu cung zad la ltos par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it has the character of destruction, it would not depend on any cause of destruction,

original: bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would have that nature itself.

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin na yang 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig par byed pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin nyid ma yin na yang 'jig pa'i rgyus 'jig par byed pa ma yin pa /
translated: If it does not have the nature of destruction, then a cause of destruction does not cause its destruction.

original: de ltar na dngos @326b po 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na dngos @326b po 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang 'jig par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, it is not the case that some things are not destroyed at some time.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu don med pa can yin no //🔽de'i phyir / gang dag de yod gzhan ltos med //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu don med pa can yin no // de'i phyir / gang dag de yod gzhan ltos med //
translated: Therefore, the cause of destruction is purposeless.🔽Thus,🔽Those that exist without depending on another

original: gang dag dngos po gang la ltos pa med pa /
analyzed: gang dag dngos po gang la ltos pa med pa /
translated: Those that do not depend on any other thing

original: de dag de dngos la nges yin //
analyzed: de dag de dngos la nges yin //
translated: Are ascertained to be that thing.

original: dper na 'bras bu'i las la ste //
analyzed: dper na 'bras bu'i las la ste //
translated: For example, in the case of the effect of karma,

original: 'bras bu byed pa la tha ma'i tshogs pa gags byed pa ni srid ma yin /
analyzed: 'bras bu byed pa la tha ma'i tshogs pa gags byed pa ni srid ma yin /
translated: It is not possible for the final collection of causes to obstruct the production of the effect.

original: dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa ni ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the destruction of things does not depend on anything else.

original: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi tshe yang 'jig pa'i ngang tshul can ma yin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: It is established that they are not not of the nature of destruction at some time.

original: tshad ma rnam 'grel las gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o /🔽// / phal cher skal ba med nyid dang // dus la sdod pa med pa dang // goms pa'i phyir ni mdor bsdus nas //
analyzed: tshad ma rnam 'grel las gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i le'u ste bzhi pa'o /🔽// / phal cher skal ba med nyid dang // dus la sdod pa med pa dang // goms pa'i phyir ni mdor bsdus nas //
translated: This is the fourth chapter, on inference for the sake of others, from the Pramanavarttika.🔽The main body of the text is divided into three parts:

original: kho bos dka' 'grel 'di byas so //
analyzed: kho bos dka' 'grel 'di byas so //
translated: I have composed this commentary.

original: smra ba chen po slob dpon lha dbang blos mdzad pa tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi dka' 'grel rdzogs so /
analyzed: smra ba chen po slob dpon lha dbang blos mdzad pa tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi dka' 'grel rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the difficult points of the Pramānﬁ avārttika composed by the great master Mānavākya is completed.

original: // / bod kyi dpal lha btsan po lha btsun pa byang chub 'od kyi bka' lung gis /
analyzed: // / bod kyi dpal lha btsan po lha btsun pa byang chub 'od kyi bka' lung gis /
translated: By the command of the Tibetan king, the glorious Lha btsan po Byang chub ’od,

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po chen po su bhu ti shr'i dang / sgra bsgyur gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong dge ba'i blo gros kyis bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po chen po su bhu ti shr'i dang / sgra bsgyur gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong dge ba'i blo gros kyis bsgyur ba'o /
translated: the great Indian abbot Subhutiśrī and the translator, the monk Ge-way-lo-dro, translated this.
